com.pcmiler.routing
Class RouteOptions

java.lang.Object
  com.pcmiler.routing.RouteOptions
public class RouteOptions
extends java.lang.Object

This class represent the various options that can be selected when computing a route.

Field Summary
static int HEAVY_VEHICLE
          This constant specifies that the routing engine should compute the route assuming that the vehicle being used is a full size tractor trailer.
static int LIGHT_VEHICLE
          This constant specifies that the routing engine should compute the route assuming that the vehicle is a smaller commerical vehicle which does not need to worry about 13'6" restrictions.
static int REPORT_BY_ORDER
          This constant specifies that the routing engine should report the states in the order encountered in a state report.
static int REPORT_BY_STATE
          This constant specifies that the routing engine should report the states in alphabetical order in a state report.
static int ROUTING_53FT
          This constant specifies that the routing engine should compute a route attempted to stay on roads for 53 foot trailers as much as possible.
static int ROUTING_NATIONAL
          This constant specifies that the routing engine should compute the route attempted to stay on roads designated as part of the National Network as much as possible.
static int ROUTING_PRACTICAL
          This constant specifies that the routing engine should compute the most practical route.
static int ROUTING_SHORTEST
          This constant specifies that the routing engine should compute the shortest route.
static int ROUTING_TOLL
          This constant specifies that the routing engine should compute a route that avoids tolls as much as possible.
static int UNITS_KM
          This constant specifies that the routing engine should report the distances using kilometeres.
static int UNITS_MILE
          This constant specifies that the routing engine should report the distances using miles.

Constructor Detail

RouteOptions

public RouteOptions()
Constructs a new RouteOptions obejct with a set of default values. The default values are: Practical routing, heavy vehicle, State Order for the state report, non-hub mode, borders open, custom routing off, distance in miles, no memo, no route name, the North American Region, to be drawn in Cyan, and a width of 8 pixels on screen.

NOTE: Not all of these options are supported by the server interface yet. Only routing mode, hub mode, and units are currently supported. The memo field, and the routeName field are not used at all by the server and are designed for user use.

Method Detail

getCustom

public boolean getCustom()
Returns the value of the custom routing option. If true, routing takes into account avoid and favor that have been specified to the data server.

Returns:
The custom routing option.

getBordersOpen

public boolean getBordersOpen()
Returns the value of the borders open option. If the borders are specified as open, the routing engine will freely cross international boundaries.

Returns:
The borders open option.

getHub

public boolean getHub()
Returns the value of the hub mode option. In hub mode, the first stop is assumed to be the hub, and each additional stop is a destination. A seperate route is run between each destination and the hub.

Returns:
The hub mode option.

getUnits

public int getUnits()
Returns the unit of distance being used by the route.

Returns:
The units in use.

getRoutingMode

public int getRoutingMode()
Returns the routing mode being used by the route.

Returns:
The routing mode in use.

getVehicleType

public int getVehicleType()
Returns the type of vehicle being driven.

Returns:
The vehicle type.

getRouteName

public java.lang.String getRouteName()
Returns the name of the route. This field is intend for programmer use.

Returns:
The name of the route.

getMemo

public java.lang.String getMemo()
Returns the memo associated with the route. This is a free form text field to be used how ever the user wishes.

Returns:
The memo.

getRegion

public java.lang.String getRegion()
Returns the region in which this route is being run.

Returns:
The region in use.

getReportOrder

public int getReportOrder()
Returns the order in which states are listed in the state report. The REPORT_BY_STATE option lists the states in alphabetical order, while the REPORT_BY_ORDER lists the states in the order encountered in the route.

Returns:
The order in which states are listed.

getColor

public java.lang.String getColor()
Returns the color used to draw the route. This is used in conjuction with the mapping classes.

Returns:
The color to draw the route..

getWidth

public int getWidth()
Returns the width to draw the route. This is used in conjuction with the mapping classes.

Returns:
The width to draw the route.

setCustom

public void setCustom(boolean in)
This function sets the value of the custom mode variable. A value of true instructs the routing engine to respect the user's avoid/favors.

Parameters:
in - The value for custom routing.

setBordersOpen

public void setBordersOpen(boolean in)
This function set the value of the border variable. A value of true allows the routing engine to cross international boundaries. A value of restricts the routing engine from crossing international boundaries if at all possible.

Parameters:
in - The value for border crossing.

setHub

public void setHub(boolean in)
This function sets the value of the hub mode variable. In a hub mode, the first stop is considered a hub, and seperate trips are run from the hub to each of the destinations.

Parameters:
in - The value for hub mode.

setUnits

public void setUnits(int in)
This function set the value of the units variable. This determines how distances are reported.

Parameters:
in - The value for the units variable.
See Also:
UNITS_MILE, UNITS_KM

setRoutingMode

public void setRoutingMode(int in)
This function sets the routing mode used by the routing engine.

Parameters:
in - The value for the routing mode.
See Also:
ROUTING_PRACTICAL, ROUTING_SHORTEST, ROUTING_NATIONAL, ROUTING_TOLL, ROUTING_53FT

public void setRouteName(java.lang.String in)
This function sets name of the route.

Parameters:
in - The name of the route.

setMemo

public void setMemo(java.lang.String in)
This function sets a memo for the route. The memo is an arbitrary text string that is associated with the route. It can be used for what ever the user wants. Its contents have no bearing on the performance of the routing engine.

Parameters:
in - The memo for the route.

setRegion

public void setRegion(java.lang.String in)
This function sets the region of the world in which the route will be run.

Parameters:
in - The region

setColor

public void setColor(java.lang.String c)
This function sets the color in which the route will be drawn when used in conjuction with PC*MILER mapping.

Parameters:
c - The color of the route.

setWidth

public void setWidth(int i)
This function sets the width the route will be drawn when used in conjuction with PC*MILER mapping.

Parameters:
i - The width of the route.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
This function returns a textual description of the major route options, in the following format: region name, routing type, borders open/closed, custom yes/no.

Currently there is no method to specify any of these options other than routing type to the server.

Returns:
A string decribing the options.
